data.name: Simple Encryption and Decryption
data.description:
Ever wanted to generate a password from a favorite phrase of yours? 

Well you will be given random encryption for the alphabet(all lowercase letters, using the ASCII table, where each letter from our alphabet will have a value where its length is between 2-4 characters.
(this is preloaded into a HashMap (Java)\ Dictionary (Python) for you)


There won't be an issue about certain letters in the language being similar like a = 12 and b = 123, there is only one solution for each encryption/decryption.



    key: a , value: d8K
    key: b , value: di
    key: c , value: h)'N
    .
    .
    .
    key: z , value gG&


You will be given a phrase/string that is all lowercase and with no whitespaces. You will then need to encrypt the phrase using the given alphabet(in java it will be a HashMap).
With the decrypt function you will take an encrypted string and revert it back to the original phrase/string by decrypting it. 

For example when given the phrase: ``"mynameisjeff"``,
encryptCode result could be: ``"KesP1/gDzqhk7Ke@x3@x3eIA"``

if we put ``"KesP1/gDzqhk7Ke@x3@x3eIA"`` into the decryptCode function then the function should return the original phrase ``"mynameisjeff"``.

Another example: now lets take the HM(HashMap) from above as our alphabet.
lets take the phrase/string ``"abcz"`` and if we input it into the encryptCode function the following steps will happen:


    String value = "" ;
    a = d8K  -> value = d8K
    b = di   -> value = d8Kdi
    c = h)'N -> value = d8Kdih)'N
    z = gG&  -> value = d8Kdih)'NgG&

    value = "d8Kdih)'NgG&";


therefore in this case the encryptCode function will return ``"d8Kdih)'NgG&"``

if we take the string  ``"d8Kdih)'NgG&"`` with the Encryption type given above(HM) and input it into the decryptCode function, in this case it will return the original string ``"abcz" ``



Your task it to write the code for the encryptCode and decryptCode that will make it return the correct encrypted/decrypted results.
